profile:
Alternative idols in pursuit of the ultimate north.

Blending shoegaze, alternative rock, IDM, and techno with fearless freedom,
RAY radiates a singular presence in the live idol scene—
where ethereal soundscapes meet raw, physical performance,
dancing until they collapse in pure devotion.

Overseas activity. In 2024, RAY’s “ASIA TOUR 2024” reached Seoul (July 12–14) and Shenzhen, China (July 28), marking their first multi-city push outside Japan. 

In 2025, they returned to Taipei for a two-man at Breeze MEGA Studio with airattic on May 11. 

This momentum coincides with their 4th album White (Oct 1, 2025), led by “Bittersweet”—written/produced by Mark Gardener of RIDE—with the single released on Sept 3, 2025 ahead of the album.

Formed in Tokyo in 2020, SITUASION is a five-member alt-idol unit blending dark-edged J-pop with rock/electronic textures—emotional melodies, trance-like builds, and cathartic drops power their intense, story-driven shows.

Abroad, they played Anime Festival Kassel (Oct 2024) and the Samurai Museum Berlin, then appeared at JAPAN EXPO THAILAND 2025 in Bangkok. In Aug 2025, they placed 2nd at the EMERGENZA Japan Final.

profile:
Overview
Formed in Tokyo in 2019, Ringwanderung is a five-member alt-idol group whose name references the mountaineering term for “walking in circles” in fog—signaling a resolve to keep climbing toward the summit. They currently release on Lonesome Record, with albums Synchronism (2021), synchrotron (2022), and aratayo (2024). 

Music
Ringwanderung fuse bright J-pop melodies with piano-led motifs, airy synths, and guitar-driven swells, adding EDM-leaning builds and cathartic drops. The piano lines act as a signature thread—from dreamy mid-tempo numbers to live bangers—tying their cinematic, emotionally surging arrangements together.

Overseas activity (recent)
In July 2024, Ringwanderung performed at TAIPEI CITY IDOL EXPO at Zepp New Taipei—confirmed by the group’s post and event footage. In October 2025, they returned to Taiwan for the three-day IDOL KINGDOM TAIPEI in Taipei; on-site videos capture them performing “Last Summer Daydream” on Oct 10.

profile:
Overview.
airattic is a five-member Japanese idol group formed in February 2022 under SOVA LLC. The name combines “air” and “attic,” reflecting their urban, everyday-life themes—“moratorium / city / quiet daily scenes / 20s.” 

Musical style.
Centered on guitar-driven rock and electronic textures, airattic balances hushed, reflective moods with energetic, live-ready arrangements—often described by promoters alongside shoegaze/alt-rock lineages. 


Recent overseas activity.
The group made its overseas debut in Shanghai in Nov 2024 (including a band-set one-man and related events). In May 2025 they appeared in Taipei for a two-man with RAY at Breeze MEGA Studio (May 11), with auxiliary fan events that weekend.

Formed in 2022 with the concept of "an idol who stays by your side when you can't sleep, and who you can enjoy even with your eyes closed." Produced by Yu Muroi and sound-produced by Daijiro Nakagawa. The current four members are a-min, Ren, Miyachi, and Sayaka. Their music is characterized by a dreamy and comfortable sound.

Known as the "Progressive Idol Unit," they perform songs mainly in the progressive rock genre. Commonly known as "Kiss Eki." Active since 2016, they have gained attention for their musicality, including performing epic songs over 11 minutes long. The five members are Moe Hiiro, Mao Kohinata, Sena Momose, Rin Kojima, and Hiyori Yokoyama.

A female idol group whose concept is "to fight," expressing an attitude of confronting difficulties without running away. Commonly known as "Neojapo." They are characterized by energetic performances based on J-pop, rock, and punk. The seven members are Ai Asakura, Miruka Seto, Hinano Takizawa, Sayaka Tatsumi, Miyu Fukuda, Nao Izumi, and Chiyori Owada.

profile:
Overview.
Kyururin te shitemite is a four-member Tokyo idol group that debuted in January 2021. The lineup—Uta Shimamura, Yane Tamaki, Yuna Chiba, and Amu Nigemizu—pursues a concept they call “cute realism,” and operates under DEARSTAGE. 

Musical style.
Their sound centers on bright, hyper-catchy J-pop with denpa-pop and electronic pop flavors, built for sing-along calls and tightly synced choreography. Recent releases and videos (“Special♡Spell,” “Maison de 520,” “Karte No.2222”) highlight the group’s sugar-rush hooks and vivid staging. 

Overseas activity (recent).
As of Oct 2025, the group’s official schedule and news list domestic shows only (including Japan tour and headline events); no officially announced overseas dates are posted.

Overview.
PassCode is a four-member electronicore/metal idol group from Osaka, formed in 2013 and now signed to MoooD Records. The current lineup—Nao Minami, Kaede Takashima, Hinako Ogami, and Emily Arima—fronts a live band and has released the 2025 full album INSIGNIA. 

Musical style.
Their sound fuses metalcore riffs, breakdowns, and harsh/clean vocal trade-offs with EDM drops and Auto-Tune—bridging J-pop hooks and pit-ready heaviness. Recent singles like “DESTINEX” (lead track of INSIGNIA) continue this hybrid approach. 

Recent overseas activity.
In late 2024, PassCode ran an ASIA TOUR including Beijing, Guangzhou, Shanghai, Taipei (CORNER MAX), and Seoul (West Bridge Live Hall, 2 days), then wrapped with large Zepp dates in Japan that December. In 2025, activity centers on Japan—album promotion and the “DESTINY to the NEXT TOUR 2025”—with no new overseas dates officially announced as of Oct 2025.

The seven members are Bibian Murakawa, Mizuki Kirihara, Rino Fukuyama, Nanako Ogawa, Natsu Minami, Shizuka Miyano, and Kotomi Tachibana.

An 8-member female idol group born in 2024 from Asobisystem's project "KAWAII LAB." Nicknamed "Kyusuto." With the concept of "You can be any version of yourself. You can go anywhere," they aim to spread "KAWAII" culture from Harajuku to the world. The members are Risa Furusawa, Aika Sano, Kana Itakura, Ayano Masuda, Emiru Kawamoto, Miyu Umeda, Nagisa Manabe, and Haruka Sakuraba.

An idol group with the concept of "Kawaii-Death," which combines female vocals with death-voice growls, aiming to "destroy the world's rules as Japan's strongest, ultimate, new-sensation idol." Formed in 2015, the group has gone through several member changes. Their song "Nippon Manju" with original members Ladybeard, Rie Kaneko, and Rei Kuromiya became a hot topic overseas.

An 8-member female idol group from imaginate, also part of HEROINES, who perform under the catchphrase, "Is the me that you loved non-fiction?" They debuted on May 5, 2021. The members are Haruka Koiboshi, Riho Mashiro, Piano Minase, Toka Nagatsuki, Marin Umi, Corune, Niina Mio, and Amu Katsuki.

A 6-member idol group belonging to WACK. The group's name is an acronym for "ANAL SEX PENiS," but is also referred to as "Anti-Social Punks." Formed in March 2021 and debuted in May of the same year. Their fans are collectively known as "Narazumono" (rogues). The six members are Namae Nai, Matilda Twins, Wonker Twins, Chicchi Chichichichi, Lion Town, and Iko Mugen no Kanata.

Formed in July 2016 as "Appare! Harajuku." Their concept is "to create and transmit 'Appare!' (splendid) KAWAII culture to the world, just as Harajuku creates its own unique culture by incorporating KAWAII from all over the world." They were renamed to "Appare!" in 2020. Their fans are collectively known as "Takenoko" (bamboo shoots).

An "omatsuri" (festival) style idol unit with the concept of "Energize Japan!" The group's name is a portmanteau of "festival," "positive," and "active." Formed in 2013, they made their major debut in 2015. The current nine members are Ruriko Doko, Hinata Yagi, Koharu Tsuji, Shiori Honda, Riona Yoda, Maaya Nishina, Nanami Hoshino, Airi Koshiba, and Ai Nanase.

A female idol group that began activities in April 2014. In parallel with their idol activities, they are also active as the YouTuber unit "URA-KiSS." In 2018, they were selected as a "Next Break Idol" in the "Yahoo! Japan Search Awards 2018." Their fans are collectively known as "888" (Hachi-san). The current six members are Seika Nakayama, Rena Oe, Nonoka Shinohara, Kotone Yoshida, Misaki Ogawa, and Sayako Matsumoto.

A female idol group that debuted on March 3, 2021, with the idea that the group is "filled with everyone's favorite things: favorite songs, favorite people, cuteness, and coolness." Nicknamed "Jamzu." It is a joint project between RIZE PRODUCTION and LIVE PLANET, with backing from MARQUEE magazine.

A two-member female idol unit that debuted on June 5, 2021, with the catchphrase, "Give me all of your cool and all of your cute, please?" They belong to HEROINES. The members are Aisu, who is also in iLiFE!, and Corune, who is also in nonfiku!. Their appeal lies in their powerful performances and strong live vocals, which are unexpected from a duo.

A seven-member idol group aiming to be "the kind of idols you'd find in a textbook on idols." They debuted on November 17, 2021. The members are NANA, RON, KUTSUSHI, RINA, ROMAN, HINATA, and KANON. The group's name reflects their desire to become beings who, like Cinderella in the fairy tale, give dreams and hope to many people.

A female idol group formed on July 16, 2020, by the finalists of the new member audition for 26-ji no Masquerade. The group's name, which means "apple peel," carries the message that "though often discarded, it is a valuable existence." The seven members are Rin Asahara, Kokone Sano, Rena Yamazaki, Rio Harumi, Sena Hiroshima, Fuka Iori, and Suzuka Sato.

An academy-type girls' vocal unit composed of members from the nationwide cafe and restaurant chain "Afilia Group." Debuted in 2008 under the dual production of Chiyomaru Shikura and Haruko Momoi. They have performed theme songs for numerous anime and games and are active as "the closest idols you can meet."

A six-member idol group with the concept of "dependency to the point of madness." Their music is characterized by intense beats that fuse digital and gothic sounds with mentally unstable lyrics. They started on January 27, 2025, taking over from their predecessor group "MAD MEDiCiNE." The members are Natsuki Jam, Enma Tora, Onaka Peco, Amagami Ayame, Kakushi Tenlu, and Fukai Numa.

An idol group belonging to imaginate, their name derived from "Transmigration." They are active under the catchphrase "Die here, and be reborn here." A member of HEROINES. Formed in 2020, their music is rock-based. The current six members are Chacha Nomoa, Ayan Shirasu, Nagi Miyabi, Niko Nanase, Urara Renge, and Ageha Kasumi.

A 9-member female idol group born in 2019 from the "TIF de Debut by TWIN PLANET" audition. Nicknamed "SuiAre." Their name, meaning "sweet alley," embodies their desire to be a healing and discovery-filled presence for their fans. Their fans are called the "SuiAre-han."

A female idol group active under the concept of "Evolving Dark Matter Idol." They debuted on December 24, 2016, as "NECO PLASTIC" and have gone through several lineup changes to become the current group. The current six members are Sakura Takamiya, Mii Masuda, Miri Aikawa, Akari Sera, Saya Segawa, and Ai Kotone.

A 7-member classic idol group with the concept of "delivering 'banquet'-like fun that makes you forget the melancholy days, with catchy and POP songs and dances." They debuted on May 15, 2022. Their goal is to hold a solo concert at Zepp. The seven members are Uruna Haga, Papiko Akane, Yui Sakino, Hinari Tsukimiya, Uni Ibuki, Miyuu, and Wakana Tsumugi.

A 4-member female idol group whose name comes from "yosugara" (all night long), with the meaning "even if the days continue like an endless night, we want to dream all night." Debuted on June 22, 2022. Managed by "WEXS," a joint project by we-B studios and sakebi. The four members are Miku Kurosaka, Matoi Shiomi, Nagi Kimishima, and Chia Mishiro.

A female idol group with the concept of "curse," expressing the world's absurdities, jealousy, and the darkness of the internet. Debuted on March 29, 2014. After a hiatus, they restarted with a new lineup on July 29, 2024. The four members are Yurane, Miko Yuki, Mao Hinata, and Nono.

A female idol group led by former BiS member Pour Lui, who acts as president, producer, and member, active under the concept of "full-body, full-spirit idol." Formed on April 19, 2020. Their fans are called "Boo-chans." The six members are Pour Lui, SHELLME, BAN-BAN, KINCHAN, BIBI, and SU-RING.

A 4-member female idol group belonging to HEROINES, formed around former "Higeki no Heroine Syndrome" member Yamu Yayoi. They debuted on October 25, 2022. Their style is characterized by a dark, heavy sound and a religious worldview, fusing gothic metal and EDM. The members are Rizu Otoha, Ray Miki, Yuna Miyako, and Yamu Yayoi.

An idol project produced by ORIGAMI Inc. with a unique league system. Members' contracts are renewed every three months, with reorganization through league promotions and scouting. A large number of idols are active based on five concepts: "Royalty," "Neat and Clean," "Powerful," "Individualistic," and "K-Pop."

A female idol group active with the concept of "exciting orthodox idols" and the catchphrase "Make Some Noise." Nicknamed "DeviAN." They incorporate various genres like UK Hardcore and Dubstep into their music, delivering high-energy live performances. Formed on December 28, 2014.

A female idol group that debuted in January 2022 with the concept of being "individualistic piano-core idols who push forward in their own way." Their music is characterized by a piano-based sound. The group's name embodies the meaning of "accepting oneself and expressing with confidence." The six members are Moe Hazuki, Rin Shien, Uni Uni, Mao Hoshino, Saki Riru, and Chiharu Kanna.

An idol group based in Kyoto, their name is an abbreviation of "Kinou made wa Positive deshita!" (I was positive until yesterday), written as "きのホ。" and read as "Kinopo." Debuted in October 2021. While living together in Kyoto, they tour the country and emphasize activities rooted in their local Kyoto community. The five members are Miri Koshimizu, Ashita Sakurane, Koharu Kohanai, Kurumi Midori, and Miko Mimori.

An idol group based in Shizuoka, their name originates from the fact that Shizuoka Prefecture's shape resembles a goldfish. Formed in 2021 as a project officially recognized by TV Shizuoka, the members all have ties to the prefecture. Produced by Sho Yamamoto, they are characterized by their community-rooted activities.

profile:
Formed in Tokyo in 2019, SOMOSOMO is a seven-member, rock-leaning idol group built on the rallying cry to “go all-out and go wild.” Their shows are high-energy and participatory, and in recent years they’ve added full live-band sets. In 2025 they announced a band-set tour and a one-man at Zepp Shinjuku in Feb 2026. Musically they fuse hook-driven J-pop with guitar-forward arrangements and chant-ready breakdowns, a style that has drawn industry notice (incl. Tower Records’ Tawarekomen). 

Overseas activity: their first overseas one-man shows were held in New Taipei City, Taiwan on Nov 16–17, 2024. As of Oct 2025, further dates are primarily in Japan.

SAKA-SAMA is a Tokyo-based idol group formed in 2016 and produced by TRASH-UP!! RECORDS. Often introduced as a “Lo-Fi Dream Pop Idol” unit.

Musical style.
Rooted in lo-fi/dream-pop and indie aesthetics, SAKA-SAMA blend airy melodies with DIY sensibilities and collaborations from Japan’s indie scene—positioning the group at the crossroads of idol pop and cool underground credibility. 

Recent overseas activity.

profile: Palette Parade is a seven-member idol group formed in 2021 (nicknamed “Parepare”). Their name reflects the idea that, like colorful paints on a palette, members with diverse personalities walk forward together with their fans. They captivate audiences with energetic, catchy songs and smile-filled performances. An open policy is another draw: photography and video recording are permitted during live shows, and sharing on social media is encouraged. Palette Parade debuted as the sister act to their senior group Masshiro na Canvas (“White Canvas”), which disbanded in November 2024.

profile:
Overview.
Malcolm Mask McLaren is a Tokyo punk-idol group formed in September 2015 under Asia Promotion. After an all-member graduation in April 2023, the group relaunched with a new lineup; in Sept 2025 they unveiled a refreshed system, then continued as five members following an Oct 17 update. 

Musical style.
MMM’s roots are in melodic hardcore / punk, long associated with their mask-themed visuals and high-energy, mosh-friendly shows—two-step beats, sing-along hooks, and call-and-response distilled into bright J-pop form. Releases like the album MELODIC HARDCORE and 2025 single “Dawn” underline this loud, live-oriented stance. 

Recent overseas activity (as of Oct 23, 2025).
MMM’s schedule is primarily domestic at present; no official overseas dates are announced on the group’s news/schedule channels, which list Japan shows (e.g., 2025 club asia one-man and Newday showcase).

Overview.
BABYTANTS is a Tokyo twin rock-idol duo that debuted on Feb 19, 2024. The members—older sister Rakuu and younger sister Kyuu—self-produce: they write lyrics and music, arrange, and choreograph their shows. Their stated goal is to reach Nippon Budokan by 2029; fans are nicknamed “Moony Man.” Recent milestones include a 1st-anniversary one-man at Shinjuku MARZ (Feb 18, 2025) and a 1.5-anniversary full band one-man at Shibuya WWW (Aug 4, 2025). 

Musical style.
Guitar-driven, high-energy rock × idol with twin harmonies and shout-along hooks; the duo leans on anthemic tempos and simple, sweat-soaked choreography designed for compact live houses and festival stages alike. (Their “self-made” workflow is a core identity.) 

Recent overseas activity.
As of Nov 2025, BABYTANTS’ official feeds and schedules list domestic shows only; no official overseas dates have been announced. (They frequently share upcoming Japan dates via their site/TimeTree and ticket platforms.)

Formed in Tokyo in 2010, BABYMETAL are a trailblazing trio—SU-METAL, MOAMETAL, and MOMOMETAL—credited with pioneering “kawaii metal,” fusing J-pop hooks and precision choreography with thunderous live metal by the Kami Band. 

Their sound shifts from power-/metalcore riffing to EDM-driven drops and sing-along choruses, a genre-mixing approach highlighted across their albums and live shows. 

Recent overseas activity (2025–26): On May 30, 2025 they sold out London’s O2 Arena—the first Japanese group to headline the venue—then launched a 20+ date North American headlining tour (June–July) with Black Veil Brides, Jinjer, and Bloodywood on select dates. A special U.S. arena show at Los Angeles’ Intuit Dome is set for Nov 1, 2025; an Asia leg runs from Sept 2025 (Busan International Rock Festival, F1 Singapore GP, plus headline dates), with 2026 festivals including Sweden Rock and Rock am Ring confirmed. 

In 2025 they released the collaborative album METAL FORTH, building on momentum from 2024’s viral single “RATATATA” with Electric Callboy.

ATARASHII GAKKO! is a four-member Japanese dance-vocal group—MIZYU, RIN, SUZUKA, and KANON—formed in 2015. They self-choreograph in sailor-style uniforms and fuse pop, jazz, hip-hop and rock with punk-level energy, positioning themselves as “youth representatives” on the global stage. 

Their 2024 digital album AG! Calling (88rising) expanded their hybrid sound and set up a multi-continent world tour. The group made a high-profile U.S. splash at Coachella 2024 with a packed Gobi-stage set, following earlier international momentum. 

Recent overseas activity (as of Oct 2025): the tour continues with Taipei on Nov 30, 2025, then Australia—Sydney (Dec 4), Meredith Music Festival (Dec 7), and Melbourne (Dec 8). Earlier legs covered Europe and North America in 2024.

Phantom Siita is a four-member Japanese idol group produced by Ado. Formed in 2024, they debuted on June 26 with the digital single “Otomodachi.” The group’s concept is “retro horror”, and they are managed by Cloud Nine with releases through Virgin Music since 2025. Members: Mona, Miu, Rinka, Moka. 

Musical style. Phantom Siita blends glossy J-pop hooks with theatrical, ominous aesthetics. Their repertoire draws from prominent creators: “Otomodachi” by Koharu (Charan-Po-Rantan), “Devilish Girl (Mashō Shōjo)” by naki-so, and “Noah” by Hiiragi Kirai, reinforcing a dark, story-driven sound. 

Overseas activity (recent). The group completed its first world tour “Moth to a flame” in Jan–Feb 2025, visiting Taipei, Manila, Singapore, San Jose, Anaheim, Dallas, Houston, Chicago, New York, Toronto, Utrecht, Paris, Berlin, and London—including venues such as San Jose Civic and Electric Ballroom. Since spring–summer 2025 they have focused on domestic shows (Japan tour and major festivals).
